snippet: Internet service providers may soon be restricted from blocking services like Netflix. Washington could learn something from the development.
abstract: Editorial praises European Parliament vote for rules that will restrict Internet service providers from blocking or slowing down services on their networks; contends rules stand in stark contrast to the situation in the United States, where Congress has refused to enact strong anti-blocking rules; underscores the Internet has become a vital global utility, and phone and cable companies should not be allowed to block or slow content.
lead_paragraph: Internet service providers may soon be restricted from blocking services like Netflix. Washington could learn something from the development.

headline.main: Europe Moves Ahead on Internet Rules
headline.print_headline: Europe Moves Ahead on Internet Rules
